      please use {setTracePropagationTargets(List)} instead

    • getProfilesSampleRate

      @Nullable public @Nullable Double getProfilesSampleRate()
      Returns the profiles sample rate. Default is null (disabled).
      Returns:
      the sample rate

    • setProfilesSampleRate

      public void setProfilesSampleRate(@Nullable @Nullable Double profilesSampleRate)
      Sets the profilesSampleRate. Can be anything between 0.0 and 1.0 or null (default), to disable it. It's dependent on the {setTracesSampleRate(Double) } If a transaction is sampled, then a profile could be sampled with a probability given by profilesSampleRate.
      Parameters:
      profilesSampleRate - the sample rate

    • getProfileSessionSampleRate

      @Nullable public @Nullable Double getProfileSessionSampleRate()
      Returns the session sample rate. Default is null (disabled). ProfilesSampleRate takes precedence over this. To enable continuous profiling, don't set profilesSampleRate or profilesSampler, or set them to null.
      Returns:
      the sample rate

    • setProfileSessionSampleRate

      public void setProfileSessionSampleRate(@Nullable @Nullable Double profileSessionSampleRate)
      Set the session sample rate. Default is null (disabled). ProfilesSampleRate takes precedence over this. To enable continuous profiling, don't set profilesSampleRate or profilesSampler, or set them to null.

    • getDeadlineTimeout

      public long getDeadlineTimeout()

    • setDeadlineTimeout

      public void setDeadlineTimeout(long deadlineTimeout)
      Controls the deadline timeout in milliseconds for automatic transactions. When set to a positive value, that value is used as the deadline timeout. When set to a value less than or equal to 0, no deadline is applied and transactions will only finish when explicitly finished or when the activity lifecycle ends.

      Default is 30000 (30 seconds).

      Parameters:
      deadlineTimeout - the timeout in milliseconds

    • setInstrumenter

      @Deprecated public void setInstrumenter(@NotNull @NotNull Instrumenter instrumenter)
      Deprecated.
      this should no longer be needed with our current OpenTelmetry integration. Use setIgnoredSpanOrigins(List) instead if you need fine grained control over what integrations can create spans.
      Sets the instrumenter used for performance instrumentation.

      If you set this to something other than Instrumenter.SENTRY Sentry will not create any transactions automatically nor will it create transactions if you call startTransaction(...), nor will it create child spans if you call startChild(...)

      Parameters:
      instrumenter - - the instrumenter to use

    • setForceInit

      public void setForceInit(boolean forceInit)
      If set to true a call to Sentry.init (or SentryAndroid.init) will go through and replace previous options if there are any.

      By default the SDK will check whether a previous call to Sentry.init has higher priority than the current one and decide whether to actually perform the init and replace options.

      Parameters:
      forceInit - true = replace previous init and options

    • isForceInit

      public boolean isForceInit()

    • setGlobalHubMode

      public void setGlobalHubMode(@Nullable @Nullable Boolean globalHubMode)
      If set to true, automatic scope forking will be disabled. If set to false, scopes will be forked automatically, e.g. when scopes are accessed on a thread for the first time, pushScope is invoked, in some cases when we explicitly want to fork the root scopes, etc.

      If this is set to something other than `null`, it will take precedence over what is passed to Sentry.init.

      Enabling this is intended for mobile and desktop apps, not backends. For Android the default value passed to Sentry.init is true (globalHubMode enabled), for backends it defaults to false.

      Parameters:
      globalHubMode - true = automatic scope forking is disabled

    • isGlobalHubMode

      @Nullable public @Nullable Boolean isGlobalHubMode()

    • setOpenTelemetryMode

      public void setOpenTelemetryMode(@NotNull @NotNull SentryOpenTelemetryMode openTelemetryMode)
      Configures the SDK to either automatically determine if OpenTelemetry is available, whether to use it and what way to use it in.

      See SentryOpenTelemetryMode

      By default the SDK will use OpenTelemetry if available, preferring the agent. On Android OpenTelemetry is not used.

      Parameters:
      openTelemetryMode - the mode
